title: Hello!
text:
Currently, I am a PhD Candidate at the Department of Informatics @ the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro (PUC-Rio). I am also a researcher at the Center for Technology and Society at FGV Direito Rio.
I am interested on ethical aspects of Machine Learning development and deployment, as well as machine psychology and data focused empirical legal studies. My recent publications have focused on the moral evaluation of Large Language Models.
You can check my Publications, as well as the materials for the Courses I teach at FGV Direito Rio undergraduate program: “Programming for Lawyers” and “Legal Data Science”.
You can contact me through my e-mail: jose.luiz at fgv.br or jnunes at inf.puc-rio.br. Feel free to contact me on Bluesky as well.

title: José Luiz Nunes
text:
About Me
I am an academic researcher interested in interdisciplinary work in Human-Centered Computing, especially at the intersection of machine learning and ethics, machine behavior, and quantitative empirical legal studies.
Currently, I am a PhD Candidate in the Department of Informatics at the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro (PUC-Rio). I also conduct research at the Center for Technology and Society at FGV Direito Rio.
You can find my Publications and Course Materials on their respective pages.

title: José Luiz Nunes
text:
Research Interests
My research focuses on: - Ethical aspects of Machine Learning development and deployment - Machine psychology - Data-driven empirical legal studies - Moral evaluation of Large Language Models

title: José Luiz Nunes
text:
Teaching
I teach the following undergraduate courses at FGV Direito Rio undergraduate program: - Programming for Lawyers - Legal Data Science
